adrFormatAddress: 1486 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10075-1399, USA

editorialSummary.text: This cozy, rustic spot with a patio and back garden draws lively crowds for small plates and wine.

originalText.text:
Beautiful spot for a cozy holiday dinner. There is a back garden area that is open in winter and covered that is lovely. The bar area is great too. They offer cheese plates and Italian cuisine. The food was just okay. I didn't have any pasta I will admit though. I did have the bruschettas which were fine and the pear and gorgonzola salad with chicken added which wasn't special. Favorite part was the chocolate salami dessert. Very tasty and easy to share at a table of multiple guests.

To me it is more about the atmosphere. Grab a reservation though, we were there on a Tuesday night and it was packed!

text.text:

originalText.text:
Left very disappointed, food wasn‚Äôt good, pasta was tasteless, not feeling fresh. Sauces was not good neither, ragu meat felt like carton. Also ordered chicken and it was a shoe sole. Apart from the piece of plastic no one knew from where it came from‚Ä¶
Artichokes burnt till taste was gone, super chewy.
Expected at least good quality and some flavor for the price you pay.
Kitchen needs to improve, service was really good.

originalText.text:
The truffle gnocchi is to die for! We liked it so much we ordered another plate of it, and it arrived fresh and hot, like biting into a warm cloud. I‚Äôd come again and again just for if. The pesto pasta is also great, tastes very freshly made. Came as a close 2nd to the gnocchi. The burrata appetizer is also good and beautifully plated.
Only downside is that it does get very noisy when packed and the tables are very close to eachother, making noise unavoidable. However, the great food makes up for it. Definitely one of the best spots in NYC.

text.text:

originalText.text: Alisa was fantastic as our server! She paid close attention to detail and even made sure I received a new menu since the original one she was about to hand me was dirty. The staff were fantastic and made sure I never had empty water. Food was great. Im a stickler for being kind and it was sad to see management be rude to staff. The hostess at the front didn‚Äôt deserve particular comments made by the manager. This is the reason for a 4/5.

originalText.text: Aesthetically beautiful restaurant and food definitely solid not amazing. Cool mocktails though. But service, highly trash. This is literally a block away from my place. Just stopping by after a long day of shopping and sudden blood sugar drop. One might say medically iffy. My would be waiter was out front...I reiterated "do you have outlets?" Seriously, no biggie inquiry, right? Right...The lady who seated me was chill about it. Made sure I had an outlet for my dying phone and my hefty bags of stuff. Cool beans. I ordered the recommended veal by my waiter since no substitutions. I get it and I respect it. Came out fast which I jokingly commented..." Y'all microwaving, lol". They give me pepper and some fresh cheese. Dope. Anyways, this is when it goes left. Mind you only there for an hour max. I get you have to flip tables to make your money. No rush of people or line but an eight table reservation on the way but it was empty and one gentleman. Literally just me and him on this patio. This gentleman was loud as hell on the phone saying weird incel/Andrew Tate misogynistic stuff like... I'm just trying to eat and regulate my body. I don't know if my waiter was on game with what he was saying. But I just wanted out. And I told my waiter if that guy was leaving. Who wants to hear all that? I don't know if that was distasteful and hurt his sensibilities. But then my waiter disappears. And three different people ask me if I was finished consecutively. And the last waiter who asked me said that it was a shift change but I seen my waiter still there? ü§∑üèø‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüôÑ It's cool I know what's up. So ‚úåüèø and you're not getting a tip.The upper east side has plenty of Italian restaurants respectfully. Skip this one.
